intro: [WRONG START] Phyllostegia olokekeensis, commonly known as the Olokele sandalwood, is a member of the Lamiaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small, shrub-like plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
